revised_title: Chemical Composition of the Humours of the Eye
tldr: The author investigates the chemical composition of the humours of the eye, specifically the aqueous, vitreous, and crystalline humour. The study reveals that these humours are composed of water, albumen, gelatine, and a muriate, with the basis of the aqueous humour being soda. The specific gravity and chemical properties of each humour are also examined and compared across different species.
